content.title: Most Funded Smart Glasses Campaign on Kickstarter | Find Out What's Next
content.creator:
Halliday
March 9, 2025
content.content:
Dear All Backers,
We are thrilled to announce that Halliday's campaign on Kickstarter has successfully concluded. We are incredibly proud to say that we have become the most funded smart glasses to date, raising over $3,200,000 with more than 8,000 backers. This achievement would not have been possible without your enthusiastic support and unwavering belief in our vision.
Over the 45-day campaign, we received an overwhelming amount of positive feedback and valuable insights from our backers. We will carefully review all the feedback we receive and incorporate it into our ongoing product improvements. Your input is invaluable to us as we continue to refine and perfect Halliday for all of you.
    What's Next?
Let's go over the next steps for:
Payment process
Collections of shipping addresses, lenses preference, prescription details, ring sizes, and frame colors
Deposit refund process
Be sure to read the details below carefully‚Äîthis information is important!
Payment Collection Process
On the first 7 days after the campaign ends, Kickstarter will start processing all backers' payments.
In this period, Kickstarter will automatically collect payment from the bank account you provided when you backed our product. Here is an overview of the steps Kickstarter will take:
If a pledge fails to collect, Kickstarter will send backers periodic email reminders in the next 7 days, and display an "Action Needed" banner when you log into the Kickstarter account from which you pledged. Follow the instructions in either the Kickstarter email or notification banner to resolve your payment issues:
Check that you've entered a valid credit card number and the correct expiration date.
Make sure the card has not expired.
Confirm that your billing information is correct.
Make sure you haven't exceeded the credit limit on your card.
If everything checks out and your pledge still can't be processed, it's possible that your bank put a hold on the charge. Sometimes, banks will decline charges if they don't align with a cardholder's regular spending patterns. Therefore, as a final resort, you may need to contact your bank to request the bank process this charge. If you have contacted the bank and the issue remains unresolved, feel free to reach out to the Kickstarter support team at www.kickstarter.com/contact.com. Or you can also contact our customer service team at support@hallidayglobal.com.
  Collections of Shipping Addresses, Lenses Preferences, Prescription Details, Ring Sizes, and Frame Colors
After Kickstarter successfully processes your payment, we will send you a survey to confirm your shipping addresses, lens preferences, prescription details, ring sizes, and frame colors. We expect to begin sending these surveys in the third week following the campaign's conclusion.
Below are some things you may need to prepare in advance or pay attention to:
1. Lenses OptionsÔºö
We offer a variety of lenses to meet your needs, including plano lenses, standard prescription lenses, photochromic non-prescription lenses, photochromic prescription lenses, progressive prescription lenses, and non-prescription sunglasses.
If you prefer to install the lenses yourself, you can choose the plano option and take your Halliday glasses to any optical store for a custom fitting. Since Halliday doesn't rely on lenses for content projection, it is fully compatible with all types of lenses.
  2. Prescription Details Collection:
We must collect the Sphere, Cylinder, Axis, ADD(for progressive lenses), and PD (Pupillary Distance) for both your left and right eyes. Please have this information ready in advance.
How to Obtain Your PD?
Your Pupillary Distance (PD) is the distance in millimeters (mm) between the centers of your pupils. 
We recommend visiting an optical store to have a professional optician measure it for you. 
However, if you prefer to measure it yourself, you can follow these simple steps:
Grab a small ruler in one hand and have your pencil and paper handy.
Now, position yourself approximately 8 inches (20 cm) away from a mirror.
Close your left eye and align the 0 mm over the center of your right pupil.
Measure the distance from your right to your left pupil.
The number that lines up directly over your left pupil is your PD (an average PD for an adult ranges between 58 and 65).
3. Ring Size Collection:
We offer a wide range of US ring sizes to meet different needs. If you're unsure about your ring size, here are some ring-size measurement apps we recommend. You can download them to measure your finger and estimate your ring size.
  4. Frame Options:
Halliday Glasses come in three colors: Black, Gradient, and Tortoiseshell. You can also let us know your preference in the survey.
Please pay attention to your Kickstarter message box and the email associated with your pledge. To help us start the delivery quickly, please fill out the survey as soon as you receive it.
  Deposit Refund for Backers Who Reserved Launch Day Offer
For backers who paid the $9.9 deposit before the campaign was launched on Kickstarter, we'll refund you the $39.9 ($9.9 deposit + $30 discount). Once Kickstarter successfully collects your payment (which occurs within the first 7 days after the campaign ends), we will initiate the refund within 14 working days after we successfully receive your payment.
Refund Amount and Accounts
The $9.9 deposit will be refunded to the payment account that you used to place the deposit.
The $30 discount will be refunded back to the account you used for pledging on Kickstarter. (Please be aware that the refund process may take up to 30 days to complete, following platform regulations.)
*NOTE: We will cross-match the backers' email list with the deposit buyers' email list to identify backers who applied for a deposit. If you find that you used a different email address than the one provided for the deposit when backing the campaign, please feel free to contact us at support@hallidayglobal.com.
  Once again, thank you all for making this historic moment possible. We look forward to delivering an exceptional experience with Halliday, and we promise to keep you updated every step of the way.
With Love,
The Halliday Team

content.title: Important Update | First Batch Testing, Reliability Testing, and Demo Releases!
content.creator:
Halliday
February 28, 2025
content.content:
Hey there, Halliday Insiders!
First off, a huge THANK YOU to our enthusiastic community‚Äîover 7,000 backers have supported our campaign, and we couldn't be more thrilled! Your trust and support continuously motivate us to keep moving forward. We've been working around the clock on various fronts, from product production to software development, and we're excited to share our progress with you!
  First Batch Production and Reliability Testing
Currently, we have completed the material preparation for the first batch of mass production and have conducted a small-scale production run.
At this stage, we are carrying out extensive reliability tests, including rolling tests, drop tests, waterproof tests, constant temperature and humidity tests, high and low-temperature tests, and vibration tests, among others. We will continue to optimize our product based on the feedback from these tests. This will help us gradually ramp up our capacity and ensure a seamless production flow. Check out the images below for a sneak peek into our process!
Demo Releases
Currently, the basic OS for Halliday Glasses is ready to go, and we're continuously refining our key features. We've been soaking up all your excitement and feedback about the demo videos! As our software keeps getting better and better, we are ready to roll it out! From the Proactive AI you've been dying to see to the everyday essentials like notification and music ‚Äì they're all right here! Click the link below to dive into the demos!
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1qTXkAZGXelYGGm9E4r5_FSrngOj_n7Nv?usp=drive_link
Also, stay tuned because we'll keep making more demo videos. Do you have something specific you want to see? Feel free to share it in the comments!
  Crafting the Perfect User Experience
We want everything to feel fluid and seamless, so we've been pouring our hearts into refining the user experience. We're currently developing an engaging setup process, designing packaging, and creating easy-to-understand product manuals. Our goal is for you to feel excited and confident when your package arrives!
Our UI designer has hand-drawn an initial draft of the setup process to give you a behind-the-scenes look. While it's still in the early stages, we can't wait to see how it evolves and hope you'll love the final result as much as we do!
  We'll continue to update you on production developments and software progress, so stay tuned! If you have any questions or thoughts, please feel free to post them in the comments. We're here to listen and make this journey as smooth as possible for all of you.
Thanks again for being such an integral part of our adventure!

comments.text: Hello, I wanted to know where I should send the distance between the pupils and the size from my finger or ring

The reviewers/influencers on social media were saying that the battery would easily last all day. I was skeptical because I own metas that don't last all day and they don't have a screen. Your demo videos show 11% battery drop (60% to 49%) in 16mins (18:27 to 18:43) Based on that it's looking like a 2.5hr battery life at most. Do you have any real-world battery life info that can be shared?
Hyped

It would be really nice if you give the option of Photochromatic lenses ... That get dark when hit by sun (UV)
I want to make sure you don't stay too far from the guided path. First iteration definitely doesn't need to do get involved in the Vietnam that is ai bloated browser than

Let it come out with a nice sweet of compatibility and capability, but it only needs to kind of do the basics right now and grow with the user or grow with the company. I think less is more. Maybe right now for the first desiration, get it right? Maybe how about the the tactile discomforts that we're gonna feel and the outer casing, and maybe the sound qualities and the vision camera qualities But I don't think we need to be in the quagmire of how to build an automated a I and earn a thousand dollars a week, creating catalogs, oh
I know how to use AI to build an assistant for you to better learn the methods and theories of instructional design technology and not try to just turn into a youtube guru.I mean.
I'm on the same page. Even before the AI, what I really want is good hardware, fast intuitive software, and essentially just a more seamless smartwatch.

Can you show better examples of real-time translation? I understand the glasses translate the speaker in real-time to your language (English for example). However, how do I respond in a way that the speaker understands? Do I speak in english and hand the phone to the foriegn language speaker, so the speaker can read it my voice in their language? Or does I have to repeat my query in the speaker's foriegn langage? I'd really like to see a video of two-way translation using the glasses, not just one-way translation where the glasses show me what the foriegn language speaker is saying.
Hello really you to make sure you have to sizes m√©dium and large Thanks

Suggestion for consideration. You can actually do live translate language == language which could be treated like live captioning. I checked with some of my colleagues who are TedX talk A. I. SMEs with knowledge of this. Consider that for update 1.1 if not 1.0.üò¨
Love this idea, especially because the proactive AI is already supposedly processing the language.

Suggestion for consideration. You can actually do live translate language == language which could be treated like live captioning. I checked with some of my colleagues who are TedX talk A. I. SMEs with knowledge of this. Consider that for update 1.1 if not 1.0.üò¨

will the a.i just have access to all the apps on my phone and I can ask it to interact with any of them. Or can you make adding APIs for apps and websites user friendly so the a.i can interact with them

Hi, ive been excited about these since I first came across them. I even did the early pledge of $9.99. But I'm growing increasingly concerned that as the campaign has been getting closer to the end the updates arent as frequent. There has been very ambiguous feedback on whether there will be SDK integ. Also the replies on the lenses are ambiguous. No clear into the Halliday OS. I really need to know if this is actually worth the investment, when I know that 3 months down the line there could be a better version. Also, the subscription model, I would end up spending monthly quite a bit to make use of the features that are best for me, proactive ai and recording. Then there is the digiwindow, in these videos this does not look anything like what im expecting. I need strong proof these will be a game changer.

There has been a lot of communication but unlike other failed kickstarters they are focusing in quality manufacturing. Remember, the technology in the glasses isn't stated to need to be replaced so perhaps after initial release it will be plenty of software updates. Many talking about o/a and interfacing that is hardly ever first round disclosed information. They will deliver, I have no doubts about that. It will be exciting when that day arrives. Lens were probably mass-generic scripts but I have seen ask and answer on progressive lens, bifocals etc all answered.
Connectivity to WhatsApp messages and Outlook alerts with replying would also be useful.
Can you add the feature that the glasses tell you when you forget your cellphone? Or will it alert when Bluetooth connection is lost.

Hello!! I just backed your campaign on Kickstarter because I find your product truly innovative. However, I have a question: I don‚Äôt have any vision problems, so it would be great to have transparent lenses that I could use both during the day and at night. At the same time, it would be amazing if there were sunglasses that could be attached on top, perhaps with magnets or a similar mechanism, allowing me to use them during the day under the sun and remove them in the evening when it‚Äôs dark. Do you think this would be possible?
How long will the ring battery last? How long to recharge.

Please I recommend that you update the software as soon as possible for the Spanish language since I do not speak English and I believe that many of us who sponsor the project do not do so. Congratulations on the progress.
What finger do you reccomend the ring go on so we can get measurements before asked
It seems the natural finger and thumb controlling for same hand would be your index finger (pointing finger). Putting it on any other would be uncomfortable for controlling
Might be a good idea to schedule your eye exam soon. Eyes rarely change THAT fast. I plan on mine close to the Campaign end date of 3/8

Is it possible to add features like reply messages back after I receive them? Let's say when I got a message from WeChat or Ins, I just need to talk to the AI:"Halliday, can you reply the message through WeChat,telling "username" that I will be there in 5 minutes?" This is super helpful when driving.
Hope you can have quick demos for the part of unlimited functions.

Thank you for the update and getting me more excited about this product. On your real time language translation service, I understand someone speaking a foreign language will.show up on the display in my language. Can this version of the glasses or a later version have the ability to translate my spoken response into another language that can be audible to the person I am talking to? Essentially, do you have in your roadmap, plans to include Google Translate type of feature for bi directional language translation embedded in the glasses?
Love the active AI feature and can‚Äôt wait to test that out in the field. I‚Äôm going to call it the BS verifier.
Lol I love it!

Love it. Great work. Regarding UI ideas, the lyrics display would be better if more screen real estate was dedicated to lyrics rather than music controls. I would also like a feature showing data when riding Personal Electric Vehicle (PEV) EUC/e-bike/eskate/onewheel. Minimum would be speed and direction which could come from phone and not need integration with another app/device. Better would be data like battery %, voltage, duty cycle, speed etc. I currently use this app written for my Garmin watch, but having it‚Äôs in displayed in my glasses would be way cooler. https://blkfribourg.github.io/

content.title: Exciting Updates: Giveaways, Kickbooster and Influencer Review!
content.creator:
Halliday
January 25, 2025
content.content:
$1,350,000+ Achieved!
Hey Halliday Insiders,
A huge thank you for your incredible support for Halliday Glasses! We've hit $1,350,000+ in funding with over 3000 backers!
Influencer Review
We've got a fantastic review from influencer Juan Bagnell, a true expert in smart glasses who has reviewed over 10 pairs of smart glasses! He shares his professional insights on Halliday's exclusive display technology and his thoughts on the future of face displays. Check out the full review now!
  Who Finally Wins a Free Pair of Halliday Glasses?!
Thank you for participating in our special giveaway event, backing our campaign, and leaving your valuable comments! Your enthusiasm, whether it was sharing your favorite features, creative uses for Halliday Glasses, or providing thoughtful feedback, has truly amazed us and offered us new insights.
  Now, let's get to the exciting part! Congratulations to our 3 lucky winners with the following Backer Numbers: 1361, 2056, 718! Once the campaign ends and orders are locked, we'll reach out to collect order details from the winners and refund your purchase after the campaign ends.
Here's the video recording the lottery process. You can click to check it out:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-vgVKKxZ5vR9eEXQGZcVbwXyqjcaWLuM/view?usp=drive_link
  Kickbooster: Refer to Earn at Least $47.90 Back
For those who didn't win, don't worry! Our Kickbooster campaign is on the way. Spread the word and earn 12% cashback from your every successful referral.
  Get rewarded with 12% cashback for every dollar you help raise for our campaign! For example, if you share your unique Booster link and someone purchases a pair of Halliday Glasses at the Super Early Bird Price of $399 via your link, you'll earn $47.90 cashback. The more people you refer to purchase, the higher your cashback rewards. You'll get the cashback after the Kickstarter campaign ends.
  How to ParticipateÔºü
1. Register as a Booster NOW:
https://halliday.kickbooster.me/boost/halliday-proactive-ai-glasses
2. Share your unique Booster link on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, Website, or wherever you'd like!
3. If your link is used to pledge on Kickstarter, you get 12% of the pledged amount.
4. Refer to your Kickbooster dashboard and watch your commissions roll in!
  Join us in making Halliday Glasses launch a huge success! Sign up with Kickbooster today and start earning cashback!

comments.text: This may be a stupid question but I wear contacts and have sensitive eyes is it possible to get non prescription strength lenses (so I can wear them with my contacts) but also get them with transition and be photochromic due to my sensitivity to light?

First of all, thank you very much for such a great idea‚Äîthat the projector does not attach directly to the glasses. I have a request and a suggestion: Since your glasses do not come with a sunglasses clip, it would be fantastic if you could also offer an option for self-dimming lenses. I believe the technical term for this is "photochromic," meaning that the lenses automatically darken when exposed to sunlight. This feature would greatly help many of us who wear glasses, as it would eliminate the need for a separate pair of sunglasses. Additionally, photochromic lenses are naturally a bit darker than regular lenses, which helps reduce glare when looking upward in a more subtle way. I assume it is still possible to add this option during production, since the correct lens number and color are determined later on. Thank you in advance for considering this suggestion.
It's called transition lens and they darken in sunlight. I'd like that as an option also

Hello I have a question would you have different sizes as I have a large face I know that meta ray ban offers two sizes Thanks Now I understand that your product will be way better than meta however I wanted to know I‚Äôm a great fan of your glasses I‚Äôm supporting you with the purchase of 2 pairs Thanks again

Hi Robert, Thank you for your support for Halliday Glasses! Currently, Halliday Glasses are available in a single size. However, the temples and nose pads are designed to be flexible, so even if you have a larger head circumference, they should still fit comfortably. Here are the details for the current frame size: Frame Width: 148 mm Frame Height: 49 mm Lens Width: 48 mm Lens Height: 40 mm Temple Length: 148 mm
the email address I used for payment is not the same one I provided with the deposit. Can I change it?
Hi, please contact our customer support team at support@hallidayglobal.com. They will assist you with the registration.

content.title: üöÄ We Are Live! Embark on the Halliday Glasses Adventure!
content.creator:
Halliday
January 23, 2025
content.content:
Hi Halliday Enthusiasts,
  Thank you all for your unwavering trust and support. Today, we are finally live! Your support has made it possible to turn our idea into reality. Halliday Glasses ‚Äì smart glasses with advanced AI features, designed for everyday wear ‚Äì are now reaching more people and will become a part of daily life. This wouldn't have been possible without you, and we're truly grateful.
  Unlimited Proactive AI Access: Winners List Revealed
To show our appreciation for the enthusiastic support from Halliday backers, we've prepared a special gift for the first 10 backers ‚Äî One Month of Unlimited Proactive AI Access! Congratulations to the following backers for seizing this exclusive opportunity!
#1 A***** B***, #2 M**** D**, #3 J*** H*******, #4 V*****, #5 F******* K******, #6 L*** M******, #7 T** S********, #8 K******* L**, #9 H***** h****, #10 B*** O**** (Please note that if you request a refund before the campaign ends, your reward will not be valid.)
  If you didn't get the Unlimited Proactive AI Access, you still have a chance to win a free pair of Halliday Glasses. Order within the first 48 hours of our launch and leave a comment on our Kickstarter campaign page. Tell us which feature of Halliday Glasses you love the most and don't forget to include your backer number. We will randomly select THREE lucky backers to receive a free pair of Halliday Glasses and announce the winners in our Update on Jan 25th.
  Top Media & Influencer Review Videos
We showcased at CES 2025, and became one of the hottest AI glasses of the event! Thousands of mentions across 100+ media outlets are talking about Halliday! From CNET to The Verge, our AI glasses are capturing the spotlight as one of CES 2025's standout innovations.
@jenniferjollytechish tested out our product and thinks it is super discreet, easy to use, and does some pretty cool things. Plus, it works amazingly well!
@tomsguide showed us the display on the frame and shared his thoughts on how it performs.
@Techradar had an in-depth conversation with our team member Carter about Halliday Glasses.
We also want to share an awesome review from influencer @Ben's Gadget Reviews. Heshares his thoughts on everything‚Äîfrom hardware, like Halliday display technology, to software features, like Proactive AI and AI Translation, plus his real-life usage experience.
  Shipping From Late March
We're preparing for mass production and are excited to share that we will begin arranging the shipment from late March! Your patience means the world to us, and we're eagerly thankful for your support.
  Help Us Share
Share this campaign with your family and friends if you like Halliday Glasses.

Backer 304# Absolutely love the preemptive AI feature of Halliday Glasses! The ability to anticipate my needs and provide seamless assistance is a game-changer. It‚Äôs like having a personal assistant built into my eyewear‚Äîinnovative and super practical!

I am looking forward to being able to have live closed captioning for everyday conversations, without the obvious looks of smart glasses. Not being bulky or having squares on the lens or green glowing like other captioning glasses may have. Being able to choose my lens to be transitioning and bifocals would be a plus. Thanks Halliday!

Backer #244 The feature of Halliday Glasses I love the most is the seamlessl integration of the DigiWindow display module into the right frame leg, making the display only visible to me, and ensuring complete privacy while remaining invisible to others. Plus, it adds almost no extra weight or bulk. That‚Äôs super #amazingüòçü•≥üöÄ. Backer #244.

Backer #833 and proud ‚Äì finally, glasses that sharpen not just my vision but my curiosity! The Halliday Smartglasses take the art of discreet information access to the next level ‚Äì and the UX with the ring? Smarter than my Monday morning calendar. Can't wait to see the future!
Backer number 305 Cant wait to test out the features and to finally feel like a native with the translation facility. Bring it on !

Backer #241 Very interesting concept that stood out to me from the first showcase event, I held off on ray ban metas as the video function was less appealing when it was just as easy to record with my phone, however using my phone whilst at work and in meetings is not as easily achieved so the ability to view urgent messages, take meeting notes and translate in real time were all very useable features for me. I‚Äôve never backed anything on kickstarter so for me these were a must have, I already pay for prescribed glasses every two years so why not pay a little extra to have all of this on top, no brainer! Cheers, Scott

Backer # 890 What I absolutely love is how they make communication feel so effortless. Imagine being in a bustling caf√© in Tokyo or a business meeting in Berlin, and suddenly language isn't a barrier anymore. The translation happens so naturally - it's like magic! The best part? It doesn't feel like you're using some complicated tech. These glasses look just like normal eyewear, but they're secretly breaking down communication walls. When someone speaks in another language, the translation just appears smoothly in your view. No awkward pauses, no fumbling with translation apps. As someone who's always been fascinated by languages but struggles with learning them, these glasses feel like a dream come true. They're not just a gadget; they're like a bridge connecting people from different cultures. And let's be real - the fact that they look stylish and offer prescription lenses? Total bonus! ü§ì It's like having a superpower that nobody can see. For someone who loves connecting with people and believes communication is the heart of human experience, the Halliday Glasses are nothing short of revolutionary. Can't wait to see how this technology evolves!

I'm very excited about this intuitive and smart device. I run two companies and that isn't easy.. look forward to the help from Halliday. I have made a deposit invoice number 10657 as well joined in on the funding by pledging and paying for soon one pair of glasses.. That confirmation order number is : ed71fa904a2485e4b14ce43095e7dcc6 I am all but excited about every aspect this device has to offer. If this device is fluid I will back it more than I'm able to say on this teeny thread. Peace be the journey.
Have pledged 444f9759f220231f85b6512dac2e474e This is an entry on the draw for a free pair. Can‚Äôt wait to get these glasses
Very excited to try some karaoke with on screen lyrics!
So is my Filipino wife. Rock on ü§ô

We are so excited, my partner and I are looking forward to the AI translation ability. I am learning Italian and feel like this feature will be so helpful as I practice. My partner has to do a lot of presentations for work, so their favorite feature is the ability to view a cheat sheet for talks! Can‚Äôt wait!
